abstract: Sri Lankan government says it will free hundreds of minority Tamil detainees taken captive during country's decades-long civil war and return large portion of Tamil land seized during conflict; move is part of reparation efforts by Pres Maithripala Sirisena.
lead_paragraph: The promises represent the most significant efforts yet announced by the new government to heal the still-festering wounds of a decades-long civil war.

byline.contributor: Dharisha Bastians reported from Colombo, and Gardiner Harris from New Delhi.
byline.original: By DHARISHA BASTIANS and GARDINER HARRIS

snippet: The promises represent the most significant efforts yet announced by the new government to heal the still-festering wounds of a decades-long civil war.

headline.main: Sri Lanka to Free Tamils and Return Their Land
headline.print_headline: Sri Lanka to Free Tamils and Return Their Land
